page.title: 12DECIDUOUS WOODLAND ON ARNE
page.content: The deciduous woodland with a tree canopy of sweet chestnut,oak,rowan and silver birch is being reconstituted by felling the thick, dark, impregnable, understorey of rhodedendrons,leaving only standard oaks.This allows light to reach the ground layer so that gradually the ground flora will be enriched.Hazels have been planted and the intention is to produce coppice woodland becoming so scarce in Dorset.Coppiced woodland contains Primroses,Bluebells and many other species which will not grow under a thick understorey.In turn,a rich species diversity of invertebrates supports a varied bird life.These include Woodpeckers,Jays, various Tits,Wrens,Willow warblers and other common species.
